body:
I try to create symlink with spack view using this
```
SPACK_VIEW_DIR=$HOME/Applications/opt
ACTION=symlink

rm -rf $SPACK_VIEW_DIR
mkdir $SPACK_VIEW_DIR

spack view -v $ACTION $SPACK_VIEW_DIR wget
spack view -v $ACTION $SPACK_VIEW_DIR gcc
```
and this happens

```
==> [/Users/praveen/Applications/opt] Linked package: zlib@1.2.11%clang@9.0.0-apple+optimize+pic+shared arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 /t74siw3
==> [/Users/praveen/Applications/opt] Linked package: openssl@1.0.2k%clang@9.0.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 /u7nfvs3
==> [/Users/praveen/Applications/opt] Linked package: wget@1.19.1%clang@9.0.0-apple~libpsl~pcre~python ssl=openssl +zlib arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 /aly5ysf
==> Warning: [/Users/praveen/Applications/opt] Skipping already linked package: zlib@1.2.11%clang@9.0.0-apple+optimize+pic+shared arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 /t74siw3
==> Error: [/Users/praveen/Applications/opt] Cannot link package gcc, file already exists: /Users/praveen/Applications/opt/share/info/dir
```
title: spack view fails saying share/info/dir already present
